meanings.definition: An association of scholars or students for a common purpose.
meanings.sent1: The collegium gathered to study together for their upcoming exam.
meanings.sent2: The collegium of professors met regularly to discuss research projects.
meanings.sent3: The collegium decided to have a pizza party to celebrate their hard work.
meanings.sent4: In the collegium of young minds, ideas bloomed like flowers in spring.
meanings.sent5: The collegium was a hive of knowledge buzzing with excitement.

meanings.definition: A group of people appointed to make a decision or take action on a particular issue.
meanings.sent1: The collegium of experts convened to address the environmental crisis.
meanings.sent2: The government collegium met to finalize the new policy changes.
meanings.sent3: The collegium members flipped a coin to decide who would speak first.
meanings.sent4: In the collegium of leaders, every voice was heard before a decision was made.
meanings.sent5: The collegium stood united, ready to tackle any challenge that came their way.
